Documentation is available at xml.class.php

12    /**
13    * The file contains XMLParser class
14    * 
15    * This file contains the XMLParser class which parses the XML data to
16    * a multidimensional array.
17    * 
18    * @package WikiPlot
19    * @license http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.txt GNU General Public License
20    * @author WikiPlot development team.
21    * @copyright Copyright 2006, WikiPlot development team.
22    */
23    
24    /**
25     * XMLParser class
26     * 
27     * This class parses a given XML data to a multidimensional array by using
28     * a user-defined tag. The default tag is <graph>. The example below explains
29     * how the class works.
30     * <code>
31     * <?php
32     * $xml_data = "<root>
33     *              <graph color='234,234,233' label='string'>x^2+5</graph>
34     *              <another_tag name='tag'>This tag</another_tag>
35     *              <graph>x^2+5</graph>
36     *              </root>";
37     *
38     * $xml = new XMLParser($xml_data);
39     * print_r($xml->CreateInputArray());
40     * ?>
41     * OUTPUT:
42     * Array
43     * (
44     *   [0] => Array
45     *       (
46     *           [0] => Array
47     *               (
48     *                   [color] => 234,234,233
49     *                   [label] => string
50     *               )
51     *           [1] => x^2+5
52     *       )
53     *   [1] => Array
54     *       (
55     *           [0] => x^2+5
56     *       )
57     * )
58     * </code>
59     * 
60     * @package WikiPlot
61     * @license http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.txt GNU General Public License
62     * @author WikiPlot development team.
63     * @copyright Copyright 2006, WikiPlot development team.
64     */
65    class XMLParser {
66         
67       /**
68        * Created XML Parser
69        *
70        * Is a resource handle and referenced to be used by athor XML functions
71        * @access private
72        */
73       var $Parser;
74       /**
75        * XML data given by user
76        *
77        * Stores the XML data given by user as it is
78        * 
79        * @var string 
80        * @access private
81        */
82       var $Input;
83       /**
84        * An interested tag in given XML data
85        *
86        * The variable stores attribute(s) and data of an interested tag not
87        * the tag it selv <tag>. For example:
88        * <code>
89        * If this is an interested tag
90        * <graph color='23,25,200' lable='string'>2x^3+3x</graph> the variable
91        * Variable $Tag will look like this:
92        * Array
93        * (
94        *    [0] => Array
95        *           (
96        *              [color] => 23,25,200
97        *              [lable] => string
98        *           )
99        *    [1] => 2x^3+3x
100       * )
101       * </code>
102       * As you can see the first element in the array is an array and it
103       * will always be an array if the interested tag has attribute(s). The second
104       * element in the array will be the data of the tag as string. One more thing
105       * to be notes is that the array can not contain more then two elements, while one
106       * element is possible.
107       * 
108       * @var array 
109       * @access private
110       */
111      var $Tag;
112      /**
113       * Attributes of interested tag
114       * 
115       * The variable will always be an array whether the interested tag has any
116       * attributes or not. If the interested tag has any attribute the $Attributes
117       * variable will be used otherwise it will be ignored.
118       *
119       * @var array 
120       * @access private
121       */
122      var $Attributes;
123      /**
124       * Data of the tag
125       * 
126       * The variable will store the data of the tag. For example
127       * <tag> tag data </tag>
128       * $TagData = "tag data";
129       *
130       * @var array 
131       * @access private
132       */
133      var $TagData;
134      /**
135       * All interested tags
136       * 
137       * The variable will store alle the interested tags found in the
138       * given XML data.
139       *
140       * @var array 
141       * @access private
142       */
143      var $Tags;
144      /**
145       * The interested tag
146       * 
147       * The variable is our iterested tag. It means the tag that we are
148       * iterested to finde in the given XML data.
149       * The way you should definde your interested tag is as follows:
150       * If your interested tag is <Tag> than you should change the
151       * $Separator variable to XMLParser::Separator = "<Tag" not "<Tag>"
152       * or something else!
153       *
154       * @var string 
155       * @access public
156       */
157      var $Separator;
158      /**
159       * Constructor of XMLParser class
160       *
161       * The function initializes the fallowing variables:
162       * $Parser, $Input, $Tags, $Attributes and $Separator.
163       * It makes it possible to use XML Parser within an object
164       * by using the function xml_set_object. Besides it uses also
165       * two more XML Parser Functions xml_set_element_handler(),
166       * xml_set_character_data_handler() and xml_parser_free().
167       * 
168       * @access private
169       * @param string $Data XML Input Data from user
170       * @return XMLParser 
171       * @uses $Parser
172       * @uses $Input
173       * @uses $Tags
174       * @uses $Attributes
175       * @uses ExplodeInputData()
176       * @uses Parse()
177       * @uses OpenTag()
178       * @uses CloseTag()
179       * @uses GetCharData()
180       */
181      function XMLParser($Data)
182      {
183             //Initialize $Parser and creat an XML Parser to use later on
184             $this->Parser = xml_parser_create();
185          //Initialize $Input and set it equal to $Data (XML from user)
186             $this->Input = $Data;
187             //Initialize $Tags to be an array
188             $this->Tags = array();
189             //Initialize $Attributes to be an array
190             $this->Attributes = array();
191             //Initialize $Separator to be an array
192             $this->Separator = "<graph";
193          
194             //Set XML Parser to use it within object
195          xml_set_object($this->Parser, $this);
196          //Set up start and end element handlers for the parser
197          xml_set_element_handler($this->Parser, "OpenTag", "CloseTag");
198          //Set up character data handler for the parser
199          xml_set_character_data_handler($this->Parser, "GetCharData");
200               
201          //Call ExplodeInputData() to get the interested tags 
202          $this->ExplodeInputData();
203          
204          //Call Parse() to parse the $Input
205          $this->Parse($this->Input);
206           
207          //Free the XML parser to later use
208          xml_parser_free($this->Parser);
209      }
210       
211      /**
212       * Parses the given XML data
213       *
214       * The function uses xml_parse() function from XML Parser Functions in PHP
215       * and parses only the first tag in the given XML data and ignores
216       * everything else. So you can not use it for multitag XML data.
217       * The function also calls CreateTagArray() to generate tag attribute(s)
218       * and data to an array.
219       * 
220       * @access private
221       * @param string $Data 
222       * @uses CreateTagArray()
223       */
224      function Parse($Data)
225      {
226          //Parse XML Data using the $Parser
227             xml_parse($this->Parser, $Data);
228          //Put returned values (Attribute(s) and TagData)
229          //from XML praser into an array called $Tag
230          $this->CreateTagArray();
231      }
232      
233      /**
234       * Puts parsed data into an array
235       * 
236       * The function takes the variables $Attributes and $TagData and
237       * puts them into an array called $Tag. The first element in the
238       * array will be Attribute(s) of the interested tag and the second
239       * element will be the data of the tag. If Attribute does not exist
240       * the first element will then be the data of the tag.
241       *
242       * @access private
243       * @uses $Attributes
244       * @uses $TagData
245       * @uses $Tag
246       */
247      function CreateTagArray()
248      {
249             if (!empty($this->Attributes) && !empty($this->TagData))
250             {
251                $this->Tag = array($this->Attributes, $this->TagData);    
252             }
253             else 
254             {
255                   $this->Tag = array($this->TagData);
256             }
257      }
258   
259      /**
260       * Findes the interested tag in XML Data
261       * 
262       * The function uses explode() function and the $Separator to finde
263       * the interested tag in the given XML Data. When the tags are found
264       * it puts them into array called $Tags.
265       *
266       * @access private
267       * @uses $Separator
268       * @uses $Input
269       * @uses $Tags
270       */
271      function ExplodeInputData()
272      {
273             //Split the given XML data by using $Separator
274             $InterestedTags = explode($this->Separator , $this->Input); 
275             
276             //Go through the array containing the interesting tags
277             //NOTICE: $i must be = 1 because the array contains
278             //nothing on 0 position
279             //NOTICE: $ must be < lenght of the array and not <= because
280             //the last element in the array is not interesting.
281             for ($i=1; $i < count($InterestedTags); $i++)
282             {
283                    //Put the $Separator into the tag
284                    //(the separator vanishes when exploding the data)
285                    //fx. If the separator is <tag. The following will take place.
286                    //<tag>Hello</tag> will be exploded by <tag and
287                    //returned as >Hello</tag>. To complete the tag
288                    //we put the separator back on place. <tag + >Hello</tag>
289                    //this will return the complete tag = <tag>Hello</tag>
290                    array_push($this->Tags, $this->Separator . $InterestedTags[$i]);
291             }
292      }
293   
294      /**
295       * Handles attribute(s) of a tag
296       * 
297       * The function gets the value of the attribute(s) of a tag using the
298       * $Parser. It is used by xml_set_element_handler() function in the
299       * constructor.
300       * 
301       * @access private
302       * @param mixed $Parser 
303       * @param string $Tag 
304       * @param array $Attributes 
305       * @uses $Parser
306       * @uses $Attributes
307       */
308      function OpenTag($Parser, $Tag, $Attributes)
309      {
310             //Check whether $Attributes is an array and is not an empty array 
311             if (is_array($Attributes) && count($Attributes) > 0)
312             {        
313                     //Put $his->Attributes equal to $Attributes while changing the 
314                     //case of its key(s) to lowercase. The case of the key(s) is 
315                     //importan due to avoid error later on.  
316                     $this->Attributes = array_change_key_case($Attributes, CASE_LOWER);
317             }
318             else
319             { 
320                     //$this->Attributes will be an empty array() which is ignored
321                     //when adding it to the general array which is return by the 
322                     //class!             
323             }
324      }
325      
326      /**
327       * Gets data of the tag
328       * 
329       * The function gets the data of an interesting tag by using the
330       * $Parser. It is used by xml_set_character_data_handler() function
331       * in the constructer.
332       *
333       * @access private
334       * @param mixed $Parser 
335       * @param string $CharData 
336       * @uses $Parser
337       * @uses $TagData
338       */
339      function GetCharData($Parser, $CharData)
340      {
341              //Set $this->TagData equal to $CharData
342              //for later use.
343                 $this->TagData = $CharData;
344      }
345       
346      /**
347       * Handles end/closing tag
348       * 
349       * The function gets the end/closing tag using the $Parser.
350       * It is used by xml_set_element_handler() function  in the
351       * constructer.
352       * 
353       * @access private
354       * @param mixed $Parser 
355       * @param string $Tag 
356       * @uses $Parser
357       */
358      function CloseTag($Parser, $Tag)
359      {
360          //Have nothing do to! :(
361          //But must be present.
362      }
363   
364      /**
365       * Creates an array containing all parsed XML data
366       * 
367       * The function runs each and every tag in the $Tags array
368       * through the XMLParser object. The parsed data is then
369       * stored in the $Graph which is returned at the end of the
370       * proces.
371       *
372       * @access public
373       * @return $Graph 
374       * @uses $Tags
375       * @uses XMLParser
376       */
377      function CreateInputArray()
378      {
379            //Create an array to store the parsed XML data in it
380            //and then return it at the end of the proces.
381         $Graph = array();
382                  
383         //Get each interested tag from $Tags 
384            foreach( $this->Tags as $Tag )
385            {
386                //Create instance of XMLParser and parse the
387                //single tag to it
388                $XMLParser = new XMLParser($Tag);
389              //Store the data parsed by the XMLParser in the $Graph
390                array_push($Graph, $XMLParser->Tag);
391            }
392         
393            //Return the $Graph to user
394            return $Graph;
395      }   
396   }
397   ?>
Documentation generated on Fri, 13 Oct 2006 06:44:43 +0200 by phpDocumentor 1.3.0RC3
